Spatial At End.Your Task:
Manipulate the (blue) Camera Sliders on the left
side of the screen to move the camera view. You
can move the camera at any time.
Click 'Next' when finished

Select the 'Labels On' button to turn on tree
terminology. To turn off the labels, select the
'Labels Off' button. You can choose to turn on
the labels at any time.
Click 'Next' when finished

Draw from points A to B to 'prune' the tree. Then
select from the three choices to label your cut.
You must label your cut before you continue.

If no cut appears, draw with the branch centered.
Click 'Done' to submit or enable reseting ALL cuts.

This concludes the interface tutorials.
Click 'Next' to proceed to the learning activities.

Select the different 'Tree Terminology' Buttons to
explore the different parts of a tree.
Click 'Next' when finished

Select each button to explore the different cut
types. Click 'Next' when finished.

Select the different 'Branch Vigor' Buttons to
learn the three levels of Branch Vigor.
Click 'Next' when finished

This concludes the Terminology Section. Click
'Next' to proceed to the next learning
activity section.

Move the Branch Manipulation Slider
to see how Branch Vigor affects pruning
cut decisions. Click 'Next' when finished.

Move the Branch Manipulation Slider until the
branch is Strong in vigor. Click 'Submit'
to check your answer.

Identify the correct cut using the
drop-down menus for the labeled branches.
Click 'Submit' to check your answer.

This concludes the vigor tutorials.
Click 'Next' to proceed to the next activity.

Select each button to explore how to apply
the '6 inch rule' to the labeled branches.
You may need to move the camera to see.
Click 'Next' when finished.

Move the Branch Manipulation Slider
to see how Branch Spacing affects pruning
cut decisions. Click 'Next' when finished.

Move the Branch Manipulation Slider until the
spacing between branches is 'Too Close' and
needs a 'Thinning Cut'.
Click 'Submit' to check your answer.

Move the Branch Manipulation Slider to see
how Branch Vector affects pruning decisions.
You may need to move the camera to see
the branch. Click 'Next' when finished.

Move the Branch Manipulation Slider until you
do not need to prune the branch with a
'Thinning Cut'. You may need to move the camera
to see the branch. Click 'Next' when finished.

This concludes the Canopy Section. Click 'Next'
to proceed to the next learning activity section.

Select the different 'Bud Spacing' Buttons to
learn different 'Bud Spacing' examples.
Click 'Next' when finished

Select the different 'Bud Spacing' Buttons to
learn different 'Bud Spacing' examples.
Click 'Next' when finished

Move the Branch Manipulation Slider
to see how Bud Spacing affects pruning
cut decisions. Click 'Next' when finished.

Move the Branch Manipulation Slider
until the buds are 'Too Close' and need
to be pruned with a 'Heading Cut'.
Click 'Next' when finished.

This concludes the Bud Spacing Section. Click
'Next' to proceed to the next learning
activity section.

Prune the tree section. When finished, click 'Done'
 to submit or to enable reseting all cuts.

Answer the question and select 'Submit'
before clicking 'Next'

Select the dropdown menu to see pruning
explanations for the corresponding branch.
